intro: Bouvardia tenuis, commonly known as the pink bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and slightly hairy, while the stems are slender and branching. Bouvardia tenuis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a potted plant.
